Description: A: One fragment of an ear-ring made of whitish faience, small fragment of the ring body is preserved, with a thin almost rectangular section. Getting wider towards one end, both ends broken off. B: One cylindrical bead made of whitish-cream coloured faience. C: Fragment of a segmented cylindrical bead made of white faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2, south of floor level II, debris
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
